name: 2009 MLB All-Star Game Quiz | All-Star Games | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where did the 2009 MLB All-Star game take place?
questions.explanation:
St. Louis, Missouri

	The 2009 MLB All-Star game took place in St.Louis, home of the St. Louis Cardinals.

questions.text: Who took MVP honors in the All-Star game?
questions.explanation:
Carl Crawford, Tampa Bay Rays.

	Carl Crawford took the award and he stole a home run that would've cost them the game.

questions.text: How did the American League make the game-winning run?
questions.explanation:
Sacrifice fly.

	The American League got the game winning run by a sacrifice fly in the bottom of the 8th by Adam Jones.

questions.text: What was the final score of the 2009 MLB All-Star game?
questions.explanation:
4-3.

	The American League took the crown 4-3 which was also the score of the 2008 MLB All-Star game.

questions.text: The American League's 2009 win was their _____ consecutive All-Star game without losing.
questions.explanation:
13th.

	The American League has won every All-Star game since 1996, except in 2002 the game ended in a 7-7 tie.

questions.text: How many Florida Marlins were representatives in the All-Star game?
questions.explanation:
2.

	The 2 players were Hanely Ramirez who played shortstop and Josh Johnson who was a pitcher.

questions.text: Who threw the pre-ceremony first pitch?
questions.explanation:
President Barack Obama.

	President Barack Obama threw the pre-ceremony first pitch for the All-Star game and threw somewhat of a left-handed strike to Cardinal Albert Pujols.

Joe Maddon, Tampa Bay Rays.

	Joe Maddon managed the American League and represented the Tampa Bay Rays.  He was selected because he took the Rays to the World Series in 2008.

Charlie Manuel, Philidelphia Phillies.

	Charlie Manuel managed the National League and represented the Phillies.  He along with AL manager Joe Maddon was selected due to him taking the Phillies to the World Series in 2008.

questions.text: What was the attendance in the 2009 MLB All-Star game?
questions.explanation:
46,760.

	The attendance was 46,760 at Busch Stadium, which also played the Futures Game. The Futures Game by future MLB All-Stars who play in the Minor League.
